DOC.brief_summary: The objective Males , Antioxidants , Infertility ( MOXI ) Trial examine whether treatment infertile male antioxidant formulation improve male fertility . The central hypothesis treatment infertile male antioxidant improve sperm structure function , result high fertilization rate improve embryo development , lead high pregnancy live birth rate . Findings research significant likely lead effective , non-hormonal treatment modality male infertility . An effective treatment men would also reduce treatment burden female partner , low cost , provide effective alternative couple religious ethical contraindication ART ( Assisted Reproductive Technology ) . If antioxidant improve pregnancy rate , improve sperm motility DNA integrity , could allow couple male factor infertility use less intensive therapy intrauterine insemination . Male fertility specialist currently prescribe antioxidant base limited data support use . A negative finding , lack benefit , would also alter current treatment infertile male .
DOC.criteria: Couple 12 month infertility ( primary secondary ) Heterosexual Cohabitating able regular intercourse Male : ≥ 18 year age At least one abnormal semen parameter semen analysis within past 6 month : Sperm concentration ≤15 Million/ml Total motility ≤40 % Normal morphology ( Kruger ) ≤4 % DNA fragmentation ( SCSA , DNA fragmentation index ) > 25 % Female : ≥18 year age ≤38 year age For woman ≥ 35 year age , evidence normal ovarian reserve assess menstrual cycle day 3 ( +/2 day ) FSH ≤10 IU/L estradiol ≤ 70 pg/mL , AMH ≥ 1.0 ng/mL , OR antral follicle count > 10 within one year prior study initiation . Evidence least one patent fallopian tube determine hysterosalpingogram laparoscopy show least one patent fallopian tube saline infusion sonogram show spillage contrast material Regular cycle define ≥25 day ≤35 day duration Evidence ovulation include biphasic basal body temperature , positive ovulation predictor kit , progesterone level ≥3 ng/ml . Couple : Previous sterilization procedure ( vasectomy , tubal ligation ) . The prior procedure may affect study outcome . Planning vitro fertilization next 6 month Male : Sperm concentration < 5 million/mL screen semen analysis Current use medication drug would affect reproductive function metabolism ( see Appendix C list ) Current multivitamin herb use ( require 1 month washout ) Current serious medical illness , cancer , heart disease , cirrhosis Current use anticoagulant Untreated hypothyroidism Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus Female : History endometriosis Body mass index > 35 kg/m2 Currently pregnant History polycystic ovarian syndrome Current serious medical illness , cancer , heart disease , cirrhosis History systemic chemotherapy pelvic radiation Current use medication drug would affect reproductive function metabolism
